data.title: Roderick by John Sladek
data.meta_description:
Release date 1980 | Roderick is a one-of-a-kind robot with true intelligence and
understanding who progresses through a world dead-set on ignoring him.
From ...
data.text: Roderick is a one-of-a-kind robot with true intelligence and understanding who progresses through a world dead-set on ignoring him. From university academia to catholic high schools to rural towns, no one seems to want to deal with him, much less even acknowledge that he is, quite obviously, a robot. Roderick's naivete and the rest of the world's ignorance serve to let this satire attack anything and everything.
